events.originalText: The video game Doom, later considered the "father" of the first-person shooter genre, is released.
events.subtitle: Doom (1993 video game)
events.headline: Video game Doom released, considered 'father' of first-person shooter genre

events.originalText: At the first open pro-democracy demonstration in Mongolia, journalist Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj announced the formation of the Mongolian Democratic Union, which would be instrumental in ending communist rule four months later.
events.subtitle: Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj
events.headline: Journalist Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj forms Mongolian Democratic Union at pro-democracy demonstration

events.originalText: Raúl Alfonsín (pictured) became the first democratically elected president of Argentina to take office after more than seven years of military dictatorship.
events.subtitle: Raúl Alfonsín
events.headline: Raúl Alfonsín inaugurated as first democratically elected president of Argentina

events.originalText: Around the northern Thai village of Mae Salong, remnants of Chinese anti-communist forces now fighting on behalf of the Thai government launched a five-year campaign against local communist insurgents.
events.subtitle: Santikhiri
events.headline: Chinese anti-communist forces launch campaign against local insurgents in northern Thai village

events.originalText: Edward Raczyński of the Polish government-in-exile issued a note that was the first official report on the Holocaust.
events.subtitle: Edward Bernard Raczyński
events.headline: Edward Raczyński issues first official report on Holocaust

events.originalText: Second World War: The Royal Navy capital ships HMS Prince of Wales and HMS Repulse were sunk by Imperial Japanese Navy torpedo bombers east of Malaya.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Royal Navy capital ships HMS Prince of Wales and HMS Repulse sunk by Japanese torpedo bombers

events.originalText: Edward VIII, desiring to marry the American socialite Wallis Simpson against widespread British opposition, signed the instrument of abdication to renounce the throne in favour of his brother George VI.
events.subtitle: Edward VIII
events.headline: Edward VIII signs abdication to marry Wallis Simpson, George VI becomes king

events.originalText: The conclusion of the Emu War, after the Australian Government ordered the withdrawal of all Australian forces from the conflict.
events.subtitle: Emu War
events.headline: Emu War concludes as Australian forces withdraw

events.originalText: Calbraith Perry Rodgers completed the first transcontinental flight across the United States.
events.subtitle: Calbraith Perry Rodgers
events.headline: Calbraith Perry Rodgers completes first transcontinental flight across US

events.originalText: During the Brown Dog affair, protesters marched through London and clashed with police officers in Trafalgar Square over the existence of a memorial (pictured) for animals that had been vivisected.
events.subtitle: Brown Dog affair
events.headline: Protesters clash with police in London over Brown Dog affair memorial

events.originalText: On the fifth anniversary of the death of their founder, Swedish chemist and industrialist Alfred Nobel, the first Nobel Prizes were awarded in Stockholm.
events.subtitle: Alfred Nobel
events.headline: First Nobel Prizes awarded in Stockholm on anniversary of Alfred Nobel's death

events.originalText: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by American author Mark Twain was first published in the United Kingdom and Canada, two months earlier than in the US.
events.subtitle: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
events.headline: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn published in UK and Canada before US

events.originalText: Militia forces led by Nguyễn Trung Trực, an anti-colonial leader in southern Vietnam, sank the French lorcha L'Esperance.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Trung Trực
events.headline: Nguyễn Trung Trực sinks French lorcha L'Esperance in southern Vietnam

events.originalText: "Il Canto degli Italiani", the Italian national anthem since 1946, made its public debut in Genoa.
events.subtitle: Il Canto degli Italiani
events.headline: Italian national anthem 'Il Canto degli Italiani' debuts in Genoa

events.originalText: The first edition of the Encyclopædia Britannica was released in Edinburgh.
events.subtitle: Encyclopædia Britannica First Edition
events.headline: First edition of Encyclopædia Britannica released in Edinburgh

events.originalText: Edmond Halley presented the paper De motu corporum in gyrum, containing Isaac Newton's derivation of Kepler's laws from his theory of gravity, to the Royal Society.
events.subtitle: Edmond Halley
events.headline: Edmond Halley presents Isaac Newton's derivation of Kepler's laws to Royal Society

events.originalText: The Papal States, France, Aragon and the Holy Roman Empire formed the League of Cambrai, an alliance against the Republic of Venice.
events.subtitle: Papal States
events.headline: Papal States, France, Aragon, and Holy Roman Empire form League of Cambrai against Venice
